Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was an nice experience staying with you the best thing was Your Courteous Staff they were very helpful and smiling. Also cleanness was god Only thing is shower need some work as to maintain cold/hot water

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: rach6101
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a nice location, walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe. Room was clean and staff were happy to help. Nice place, and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Sunlily6336
Reviews.Content: During our stay we found the hotel staff to be somewhat ignorant. The rooms are average and the floor was not too clean and the housekeeping staff would knock as they were entering. We had a non smoking room but our room and bedding stank of cigars (which was. Quite disgusting. Breakfast was not worth the money. I wouldn't be in a hurry to stay here again, especially when there are other hotels close by that charge around the same $ but appear far superior.!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDay295371
Reviews.Content: Lovely location in a charming avenue, great restaurants around - walking distance to Champs Elysees, clean rooms, not too big, but a great place to stay for a weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Avenue des Ternes”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A convenient hotel between Arc de Triomphe and Palais des Congres. Ideal if you have to attend to any event or show at Palais des Congres. 10 minutes walk maximum. Many taxis as well going thru Avenue des Ternes. Hotel is nice, rooms are well organized, very modern. Breakfast is simple but rather good, with fresh and quality products, a special service in december with BIO products. A good place to stay, reasonable budget for good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for New Year Years & Recommend Mercure Paris Etoile”
Reviews.Author: zmastercanada
Reviews.Content: While the hotel rooms are small by North American standards, it average for Europe (& large bed for Europe). The funky shower, lighting & furnature that others have mentioned give it the impression of more space. The only way to feel cramped is if you have too much luggage (after dragging too much luggage around Europe, especially up/down metro stairs, we learned from www.onebag.com how to pack for several weeks with just carryon luggage & works fine). Only quirk with the free wireless is that you have to re-register every 6 hours - as a business traveler that would be a pain but since this is a vacation trip its OK). BTW-in room guide says no Voip or peer to peer on the WiFi, can't comment on the peer to peer but we had our Vonage Voip working fine & did a quick test of Skype with no hitches either. €18 for breakfast is a bit steep but next door at Pomme de Pain, €6 gets a small coffee, small juice, crossent & yogurt. Room also has a very small fridge but good enough for wine, snacks, juice, milk, cerial from the Monoprix next door. Hotel can also do your laundry but there is a self service laundrymart 50m away (on rue de Monteotte) where for ~€10 can do 2 loads in under an hour. Plentry of good resturants in the area, especially in the squares of the residential areas a couple of blocks away. Arc du Triomphe metro station 500m away (metro 1, 2 & 6, RER A plus Les Cars AirFrance shuttle bus to/from airports) & Trenes station 200m away (metro 2), but walk everywhere anyway. And Orange Boutique store 3 blocks down Trenes for prepaid celular phone SIM (Mobicarte) with a local #. Great value, we prepaid well in advance for 6 nights over New Years (so still here) & got a great rate. Our last trip to Paris we stayed at a 'major' hotel (free on points), this time it was our $$$ and felt more comfortable at the Mercure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not allowed to use the chains discount”
Reviews.Author: malbers Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great. The open shower was a bit different but tolerable. It also took us awhile to figure out how to turn off the multicolored mood lighting. Breakfast was good. And the location is awesome, near the metro station. Nearby restaurants are nice. However, when we tried to use the 80 euro reward points for the chain they would allow it. Since this was what prompted us to stay there, it seemed a bit like bait and switch. We couldn't use the points when booking the room on-line and got message to use when checking in. But when checking in the clerk said no go, but we could use into pay for breakfast. However when we tried to do that at checkout were told they couldn't. Big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “* A first time in Paris *”
Reviews.Author: poppiedotdot
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Paris in June 2011 I actually stayed in 3 hotels, the first being Mercure. This wasn't my first choice - I surprisingly came across this when I was googling nearby hotels. This was my first time staying at an Accor franchise hotel and I must say I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Arc De Triomphe and the Airfrance bus to CDG airport. It is located in fairly busy array of streets where there are shops and plenty of food places. The hotel itself is very modern in decor, if not a little bit too 'red' in illumination and interior design. The reception were efficient, the lift I found to be a little cramped and this was with just a small hand luggage! The room was gorgeous, clean and spacious. I am easily satisifed but overall it was enough for my one night stay and most importantly it was clean! Free wi-fi was brilliant and the we had two double (or was it King?) sized beds that were really comfy. For the price and location I definitely think this was a hidden gem !

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked via the Hotel Chain web site. A Special deal for a King Size bed. As i arrived (even though I booked !) as a single person, i was allocated a room with two singles. Not good if like me you depend on a king size - as single beds are too short !! All rooms were taken so no chance of move. A small annoyance was the light effect system - colourful glow lights that refused to turn off - so had to turn off room power (removing the door entry card from room power slot) to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location for EuroStar”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it really a nice hotel and the location is good for me to travel from the hotel to Gare de Nord (euro star station). That is because the bus stop is just next to the entrance of the hotel. Simple. no need metro for many many lines changing and stairs climbing However, the shower can be much better if there have a door. Finally, the free wifi is good !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The best hotel with good price that you can find near Charles de Gaulle Etoille. Staff were polite and helpful, rooms are clean and new. 200 metres away from Ternes metro station (ligne 2) and 400 metres away from Charles de Gaullle Etoille metro station, the hotel has very good location. The Opera district is better to stay but if you couldnot find availability or afford the hotels in that region you should try this new hotel of Accor Hotels group.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for Paris, but some tweaks required!”
Reviews.Author: Indigo1613
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 2 nights here in a non-smoking superior room with double bed. We've stayed in Paris many times, so we knew not to expect a lot for our money (even though this is a 4* hotel). We were given a room direcly opposite the lift - I think on the 4th floor. The corridor was really narrow (just wider than one person!) so we thought we might get noise disturbance from the lift doors and people entering/exiting. We returned to reception and asked to switch - no problem. Note: there is only one tiny lift so be prepared to take the stairs or wait a while at 'rush hour.' On entering the room we were pleasantly surprised as to how light and airy it was. The room was overlooking the main street, but we didn't have any noise disturbance and enjoyed the view. The rooms are very modern in decor, with some unusual (optional!) coloured lighting effects. The w.c. was separate, and the bath/sink was next to it, with a frosted glass wall facing into the bedroom - and no door. As other people have said, this might not be ideal for people who are travelling as friends/family. As a married couple this didn't bother us, but on deciding to take a shower we were shocked to find that the bath had no shower screen and one of those ridiculous shower hoses that you have to hold with your hand!! So, it was really difficult to have a good shower and wash your hair, and avoid getting water all over the floor. This was a major design faux-pas in my opinion. The breakfast buffet selection was good, but on arrival there were no 'cleared' tables to sit at. We cleared one ourselves (not really appropriate for a 4* hotel) and then had to wait for one of the serving ladies to bring us plates and cutlery etc. She was clearly over-worked, but remained pleasant and helpful. The reception staff were also pleasant and friendly, which is always a bonus in Paris ;) Location wise, the hotel is very close to a metro line and there were many bistros, bars and restaurants in the area to sample. The area seems quite upmarket, judging by the shops etc. I would recommend this hotel - although I think I would phone first and check whether the bath/shower situation has been resolved first.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, reasonable location.”
Reviews.Author: MidgeMouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September. I must admit that initially I was a bit disappointed with the overall look of the place. Needs doing up, looks a bit tired. On the whole the rooms were ok, our first room was on the first floor but we asked to move immediately as we knew from the street that it would be noisy. The staff were accommodating and moved us to the 4th floor which was great. The rooms are average but clean, the beds were comfy, the shower was hot and powerful. There's not much privacy so no use if you are not a couple. The breakfast was just what was required and there was a good selection. We were just down the street from the airport bus stop, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and we walked back to the hotel from the Eiffel Tower one night also (40 min walk). If you are staying there visit Chez Gabrielle in the next street up, its a lovely little restaurant with great food. The only real down side is that there are a lot of rough sleepers in the area, so not great if you are walking at night. Would I return? Yes probably if it was a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Standard modern Mercure on a noisy avenue”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights with my dad since all other hotels were fully booked or overpriced. This one was not cheap either (as usual in Paris but still) but it was in a convenient location. Pros: - Decent size of room (around 22sqm) - Separate restrooms - Modern furniture Cons: - Expensive for what you get in the end - Noisy street (don't even think about opening the window) - One elevator for 8 floors which makes it quite long to wait for sometimes - Bathroom does not have a door Conclusion: It's an average modern 3 star hotel and it offers good value if you have a decent rate

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Relations”
Reviews.Author: shenik
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at this hotel in September (2-5,) 2011. Although the hotel is like a hostel type, and we didn't get the room we wanted, we enjoyed the stay, mainly because of the staff and location. All staff we encountered were really helpful and kind. Inehs at the breakfast (some orgnanic food!!!) lounge, was absolutely wonderful and went above and beyond her call of duty - merci beaucoup, Inehs, vous-etes tres gentille! Lawrence, who manned the front desk, was especially helpful when family visited, Zahra...-all the staff was very kind. To top it all off, this is an environmentally friendly hotel - a real one - not like the big ones that claim to be, in order to cut costs, and in the end forfeit customer comfort in the name of environment (see my reviews on the Toronto hotels I stayed at). I would recommend this hotel to a friend visiting Paris. And I would go again. If you book early (which we didn't) you can get some great deals at this place! it is a safe: 10 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 11 min walk to the Champs-Elysees, and if you are up to it, a nice, long 40-60 min walk to the Tower. If not, buses abound. Or the Metro. Taxis too, but expensive. The area, Ternes, is quite a hustle and bustle place, with a weekend market directly across the street, a grocery store, pharmacy, shoe store, some high end retail and restaurants around. Some homeless people (we saw 3.) La Brasserie Lorraine, which Zahra (I hope I'm spelling her name correctly) recommended, had an excellent menu, and the fish we tried was delicious. The mashed potatoes were not so good. We stayed in a superior room that had chromotherapy (does it work? I don't know, but I wanted to keep it on all the time!) but no view. Ask for a higher floor (so it's a bit quieter) facing the street, (the courtyard is the side wall of the next building - not a real courtyard,) or if you can afford it, the suite. La Seine tour was good, and if you have the time, combine it with the Paris by Day tour with a Tower visit (no waiting!!) Overall, a good stay. See my other reviews for Cambridge Suites hotel, the Sheraton Getaway and Le Meridien, King Edward, all in Toronto. A bientot, rendez-vous a Paris!

Reviews.Title: “For its location in Paris, it is a bless”
Reviews.Author: Hitch71
Reviews.Content: Make sure you ask for a street view room, it makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna4192
Reviews.Content: When we got to the entrance, we said OMG, walked into the reception we said OMG, got into the miniature lift, we said OMG...what a wonderful surprise when we opened the door to the room! It was lovely, nice comfy beds, flat screen TV, futuristic shower and sink. The room had changing colored neon lights too. The reception staff was very helpful and polite, speaks excellent English. They were also kind enough to keep my bigger luggage when we went to Disneyland for 2 nights. Location is not too bad...about 2 min walk to the Metro underground trains and about 10min to Arc de Triomphe. Would definitely stay again if I am ever back in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel. Excellentlocation”
Reviews.Author: Madamelux
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in 8th August. The hotel has recently been refurbished. Rooms are modern, clear and contemporary. They come complete with mood lighting and a nice rainshower big enough for two. Good quality/rate for Paris, a skip and jimp from the champs.

Reviews.Title: “sympathetic but not something special”
Reviews.Author: Giorgos1331
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is very convenient to visit the city center on feet. The Metro station is very close and easy to transport everywhere in Paris (with connected Metrp and RER lines). The front - desk employees are not speaking English (except one lady that we met during our arrival). Our room was in the back -yard of the hotel. It was very silent but no view except one mouse which was walking on the Backyard!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff, comfy and clean room ina fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Journette
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris on a reunion trip of my Aussie friends, but stayed here separately as the hotel the rest stayed in was booked solid and this Mercure was nearby. I was pleasantly surprised and very happy with my stay. I was in a standard room, so no chromatherapy-- boo hoo, since I'd really been looking forward to that! but must read fine print next time-- but it was a nice room on the top floor. Firstly, I checked in late, at around 12.30 at night, and the night manager was very friendly, cordial and polite. I was put in a room with a balcony-- not much of a view (interesting, though), but still nice to have, and the balcony door could not lock. The Night Manager fixed the problem on the spot, which was great as all I wanted was to crash into bed. The bed was very comfy, the room clean, and as it was a warm night, the air-conditioning made the temperature just perfect. I found the bathroom with no door a little unusual, but as I was on my own, it was fine. The location was just GREAT. It didn't take long to wander to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The day staff were friendly and attentive, too. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bengal-tiger
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous stay at this hotel over Easter with my husband for our 10th wedding anniv. Great location within walking distance to the Arc and Champs. The manager Antoine Caffarena was a pleasure to deal with and so were the girls at the reception desk. Christine was particularly helpful in making reservations for dinner and at Moulin Rouge. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the street but was quiet enough for a major city. We had a fabulous view. The room was very modern and comfortable and quite spacious by European standards. The bathroom was uber modern with a very large sink and tub but the hand held shower and no shower curtain was difficult to use without getting the whole bathroom wet. Not sure how I could have washed my long hair crouched in the tub, with one hand, without soaking the entire bathroom! Luckily we just stayed for 3 nts so I refrained from the arduous task. Breakfast was excellent with all kinds of meats, cheeses and breads and cappuccinos could be had for the asking. The only glitch was trying to get some urgent work done on their computer. The touch screen computer was an absolute pain and the internet connection was so painfully slow that all the emails I sent bounced back so it was a complete waste of time! Other than that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Paris apart from being charged triple by a cabbie which left a bad taste in our mouths. Another cabbie threw a hissy fit when I asked him to take one street and not the other. I returned to Paris after 25 yrs, having lived there for a while and it is still a very beautiful city but you do encounter a lot more people with attitude here than in other cities. A lot of people were very nice and helpful but a great deal more walked around with a chip on their shoulder so some things just don't change!

Reviews.Title: “great location,good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DominicBathEngland
Reviews.Content: i very much enjoyed my stay here.it is a short walk from the Arc de Triomphe where there is a massive metro station but also has ternes metro a minute away.Yes,the lift is tiny and i could not understand why there was only 7 coathangers as total storage.No wardrobe or chest of drawers. On the very positive side ,the large windows open fully,the air -con is superb and the shower has a plate size head with real pressure (no bath). Next door is a fullt stocked supermarket ,the place to buy water ,wine,whatever.Opposite is Pauls that does a croissant,cafe and a freshly squeezed orange juice for a total of 5 euros. The room is compact but one goes to Paris to get out and i would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Mercure”
Reviews.Author: PushkarNSW
Reviews.Content: Very central location, can walk to all paris locations. Close to Ternes and Charles de guille etoile stations. Rooms are small and the shower arrangement is interesting - no wall or door. Ok for a couple. Receptionist staff very helpful. Amazingly quiet for a such a busy area. Loved the free Wifi. Paul's bakery across the road very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very helpful”
Reviews.Author: drdc1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the Paris Marathon & found the location to be pretty perfect. Couple of minutes walk to the Arc & a major metro station. Staff were very friendly & helpful. The rooms are not the biggest but are well fitted out and very comfortable. Very well sound proofed so no problems with noise despite being central. Plenty of shops,restaurants & bars near-by. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. The location was absolutely good for sightseeing og for eating. A lot of good restaurants nearby. The service at the hotel was one og the best I have experienced in Paris . The room was very good and comfortable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “"Arc de Triomphe " Spot On”
Reviews.Author: 5StarTravel2009
Reviews.Content: Having just returned Today, I have to say the Hotel is situated in a fantastic position, Rooms very clean, we had a Suite only two there 8th Floor Room 884 VERY VERY SMALL LIFT Four People At a Time, Downside no Bar. Please take my advice. If you want to find the Arc de Triomphe its self turn right when you walk out the main door and then turn right at the end of the Street Directly opposite the Hippo Restaurant. And the right in front of you is the Arc de Triomphe, we turned left as we went out the front door and walked for mile and miles and miles the wrong way. Directly opposite the Mercure Arc de Triomphe is a wonderful Bar called I can’t remember the name as I was a little Tipsy, another tip is that if you sit outside and order you will be paying double what you would have if you order at the bar, outside seat 1 x 50cl Not a pint £9.50 order at the Bar £4.50 believe me that’s the best that you’re going to find. Be aware Pickpockets we Caught one GIRL in our friends Hand Bag.

Reviews.Title: “Funky rooms with very small beds”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by their website. Their "superior rooms" all have the same small beds,truly a queen one,wich has been a complete letdown for me. Funky lightning system in the room and interesting bathroom with very little privacy. Out of this world expensive for what you get,will never return. Good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: kaz020
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday morning. It was a 2 minute walk from Ternes Metro station which was very handy when your hauling luggage. Upon arrival at 11.45 our room was not yet ready. However we were able to leave our bags at reception and go and see the sights. We later went back to the hotel at about 6pm and went to our room on the 6th floor. It was just what we needed, clean and modern. Fantastic lighting and shower and toileteries and hairdryer were supplied aswell as free use of safe, mini fridge and free wifi. Not much of a view from our room but nice and private and we didnt spend a huge amount of time in there anyway. The towels and sheets were changed each of our 2 days. Check -out is at 12 and this was fast and again we were able to leave our bags with reception and collect later before we went for our train. overall a very pleasant experience and I will definately recommend it to others. Numerous shops nearby and a mini market acrioss the road with fresh cheese, bakery and alcohol. 5 minute walk around the corner to the arc de triomphe and numerous restaurants and bars. A fantastic gem of a restaurant is 'Chez Gabrielle' around the corner from the hotel, about a 2 min walk, fantastic steak and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Many food outlets within walking distance. Next to departmental store with supermarket. Few minutes to metro. Air France airport bus shuttle stop only 10 minutes walk away from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and exceptional service in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ParisinParis
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris with a group of friends and cannot praise the staff at the hotel highly enough. From the moment we arrived they were all helpful: from the receptionist who booked us tickets at the Moulin Rouge (when we had tried on line and found it fully booked) to the staff at breakfast and on our last day the recptionist who found us a taxi to the airport which arrived in minutes. I left behind something of sentimental value and the staff were brilliant - finding it and sending it home. The hotel is in a good location close to two metro lines with enought bars, restaurants and great food shopping close by - but not too noisy. Rooms are modern and stylish with great lighting and comfy beds Breakfast was one of the best I have had in Paris hotels - and I have stayed at a good few A real find I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller9923
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are modern, clean and quite spacious for Paris. Also great location only a few hundred metres from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Mercure serviceand location”
Reviews.Author: foodie1334
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights in August 2010 and were very pleased with the hotel mercure on the avenue des ternes. 4 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe and easy access to metro and cabs. We felt safe walking late at ight in the area in spite of homeless tenants that populate so many streets in Paris. Breakfast for 2 was better than average included in the room price as well as a tour on the Seine by boat. All in all a good value that averaged about $160 dollars per night. Privacy after taking a shower was difficult due to the way that theshower is part to the bathroom with no door. Very helpful front desk staff . We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky hotel in safe area. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: 1Angie
Reviews.Content: Having visited Paris once before I spent hours finding a place that the located ACTUALLY in Paris and in a safe area with public transport. We had to splurge a little to spend AU$195 on this for one night -- but we found out that we'd booked to depart Bastille Day, so I guess that added to the price. We were not disappointed! We were checked in early, and the front desk staff spoke excellent English and were incredibly friendly. The room was just gorgeous - as pictured - with a funky shower, mood lighting, furniture, box windows facing the street, big TV - you get the idea. The subway was only a minute's walk away and took you anywhere you needed to go. The Arc de Triomphe is an easy 5 minute walk. We were granted complimentary check out at 2pm - fantastic compared to 10am back home! On this day we got stuck in bucketing rain in town, so we had to get soaked through in order to check out on time. As we stood there, shivering and dripping all over the reception floor, the receptionist kindly gave us until 2.30pm so we could have a shower...this was such a nice gesture! We thought breakfast was included, it wasn't, so we paid the pricey $25 each for it! We didn't complain because they treated us so well. I highly recommend this hotel for couples, solo travellers etc. but particularly female travellers who want to stay in a safe, comfortable area. Thanks, Mercure! I hope the rating is increased - it is easily 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this property are the real "Etolies"!!”
Reviews.Author: RJDTravels
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying for the second time at the Mercure Paris Arc de Triomphe Etoile. I found the staff at to the hotel to be pleasant and really made my stay especially enjoyable. I arrived fairly early from the Eurostar on August 3, 2010, I was groggy, tired and perhaps a bit irritable, and although typical check in time is after 1:00 PM, staff were able to accommodate me for an early check-in, provided me with plenty of smiles and made me feel truly welcome. The room was wonderful and I especially liked the fact that I had a balcony. This made my brief two night stay in Paris all the more enjoyable. All of the staff were very attentive and helpful in assisting me finding specific museum locations, local fitness centers and dining establishments. On the last day of my trip the elevator did not work and I had to come down 8 flights of stairs with my heavy luggage, needless to say I was very annoyed. However, Aurelie, the Chef de Reception was very apologetic and offered me a complimentary breakfast. In fact, I should also state that Ms. Aurelie Gaujour also checked me in early on August 3, 2010 and helped me find a local fitness center. She is really amazing, very professional, attentive and a real star! In fact I think she is the "Etoile" at the Mercure Paris. The internet worked just fine and the bed was comfy. The hotel was within a 2 minute walk from the metro stop a BIG plus in my book. The only thing I do not like about this property is the very strange set up of the bathroom. No door and a half -glass partition so the water seems to go everywhere when you shower. This however is not unusual for many European hotels. I had an enjoyable visit. I hope they keep up the good work and offering value to consumers!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, adequate, minimalist and clean accomodation”
Reviews.Author: dicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night. Its in a good location surrounded by shops and cafe's on a fairly busy road. The reception staff were very professional and processed the paperwork quickly. I took the very small lift to the forth floor room overlooking the rather drab rear courtyard. The first thing that struck me was the curtains over both the windows and bathroom door. They were made from a rather stiff fabric and slid to one side very easily. They made closing the window window curtains simple but I was not sure about the semi transparent one to the bathroom which was itself made of glass panelling. There was a TV and coffee making facilities in the room and a very sparesly stocked minibar. The room and bathroom was very clean but why is it that you have to reach below the shower head to turn on the shower. If I can design it better than that at home I am sure a hotel designer should do better. Another foible was that you had to enter the door card into a slot just inside the door before the lights worked but there was no light showing you where the card slot was located so you had to keep the door open with an extended leg to get enough light from the corridor to light up the card slot. The room contained two chairs but they were made from leathercloth. The room was rather small but OK. The breakfast did contain a good choice of cerials, bread and cold meats and cheese along with croisants and panachocolat. Overall I would say this was very good value for the price I paid and I would stay again as it was adequate without being luxurious in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a good price”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGal51
Reviews.Content: A recent visit to Paris included a 3 night stop at the Arc de Triomphe Etoile. My husband and I were pleased to have a modern, clean and comfortable space for sleeping. We had a room overlooking the street, but had no noise problems. The location was close to the metro and withing walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Since most of our time was spent sightseeing, we didn't spend much time at the hotel. Breakfast was offered but cost an additional 18 euro per night, so we picked up baguettes and coffee across the street at Paul. A good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad location, tiny hotel, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_EU
Reviews.Content: Booked the "Junior Suite" for Valentine's weekend in Paris, prepared to pay a fortune. We were not surprised. However the hotel was a surprise, squeezed into a tiny space between a Monoprix and a lap-dancing club close to Metro Ternes. Only 8 floors, tiny lift, 4 incredibly small rooms per floor, apart from the 8th floor where they have knocked two rooms together to make a "suite". The small bed (160x200) was in one room, the bathroom (two sinks, bath in the middle, therefore impossible to have a shower) in another. Breakfast was EUR 18 each, so go elsewhere. No other facilities. The bed had a very very thin mattress on a sprung base and was not at all comfortable. Conclusion - like most hotels in Paris, and most Mercure hotels, not worth the money and certainly not at Valentines. Book the suite if you want to be able to walk around the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and location”
Reviews.Author: Janesflowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in late July of 2009 and after doing extensive research decided on this hotel. My research paid off! This hotel is very nice. It's very modern, clean and comfortable. I'm used to staying in Hiltons, Marriotts, Sheratons, etc so I wasnt too sure how this would rate to my standards, but I have to give this hotel an excellent rating. The staff was very helpful in giving us directions and the the location of this hotel is central. It's walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. There's plenty of restaurants and bars in the area and it's an overall safe area, since we were two single women. We didnt feel in the least bit uncomfortable. The only thing I didnt care too much for was the shower in the bathroom. There is no door to the shower, so it is in the open, but that's a minor issue, and didnt deter from my overall good impression of the hotel. The price is good and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Paris sightseeing/shopping”
Reviews.Author: 19katy80
Reviews.Content: This Mercure is very centrally located a few minutes from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe and about 20-30 mins walk from the river and the Eiffel Tower. A metro stop (Ternes) is just outside making everywhere else easy to reach. All the staff were really helpful and friendly. I had a problem with our room safe and they sorted it out immediately. The rooms themselves are clean and modern with a nice view and a sort of enclosed balcony over Rue des Ternes but were still really quiet. The bed was so comfortable - wish I could have taken it home. This is not an expensive hotel, however, so don't expect anything ultra-luxurious or romantic or you will be disappointed. Also there is not much nightlife in this area of Paris - we struggled to find a bar open after dinner! If nightlife is important you might be better off in the Latin Quarter. Otherwise I would 100% recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: tagchicago
Reviews.Content: I came in early (before 8AM) and was worn out. Marika at desk told me to go into breakfast room and eat and my room would be ready. It was. I asked for a room at the back with a shower as suggested by others. I had a small balcony! Very modern and sleek. Not huge, but bed was comfortable. Breakfast was included in my rate (hotels.com) and for about $188/night I was safe and close to everything and right off Avenue des Ternes Metro Station and down the block from Arc de Triomphe and Charles de Gaulle de Etoile Station. Could walk to end of block and see Arc and Eiffel Tower in distance.

Reviews.Title: “A good one for a first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kirinkun
Reviews.Content: I cant reallly say anything bad about this hotel. I chose it because of the location and the expected good standards/price ratio and I was happy with both. The rooms were not huge but thats probably normal in Paris unless you stay at George V. The hotel rooms are all of modern design , which may not be to the taste of everyone but we liked it. On the whole, we were happy with it - we wanted to explore Paris and stay in a clean and nice hotel room for night. The hotel's location is great, just 5-8min walk to L'Arc de Triomph and there is an excellent typical Paris street market accross the street, where we had our breakfast. Parking was a slight issue, as though it was located right next to the hotel, it was not included in the hotel room price and being so centrally located, was a bit pricey... but still acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and minimalist, right down to the service...”
Reviews.Author: unctarheel23
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Arc de Triomphe Etoile is situated in the perfect location, extremely close to the Metro and tons of restaurants. The hotel is clean, modernly decorated and offers good value if you can pay for your stay in full and in advance. While the staff is courteous and relatively accomodating, don't expect any tourist advice or concierge services. There is WiFi for a fee and a computer in the lobby (though it only worked for 2 days of our 5 day stay). Some tips... The hotel offers bathtubs with hand showers or standup showers so if you have a preference, be sure to ask for it up front. Also, while there is no door to the shower and sink area, the toilet is in its own little room. If you are disturbed by noise, request a room that doesn't face the street. What you lose in windows you make up for in peace and quiet as well as scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, good location but quite noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: GmcPrestonlancs
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stopped this easter, the manager seemed very helpful and let us check in our room 2hours early and let us pick either a shower or bath. Only once we felt like the staff had no time for us when on our first night we asked the receptionist where was a good place to eat and my reply was 'anywhere right' (The whole centre of Paris was to the right.) Not good service. The hotel is situated is in a excellent place. Its really close to the champs elysees and the arch of triumph. The metro station is near by the arch of triumph and you can get to most attractions from that station. To sum this hotel up I'd say excellent location, good value for money but unfortunately too noisey at night with other guests and the traffic. (even though there is double glazed windows.)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff Bathroom No Doors”
Reviews.Author: MalakLibya
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience the bathroom has no doors and i was staying with my sister and we are not used to showering naked in front of one another. definitely a no way! the Manager LOIC was very rude and treated us like rubbish. He acts as if he owns the hotel. He refused to return our money on the basis that it is non cancellabe and refused to transfer us to a PARTNER HOTEL!! The website lists NOVOTEL, SOFITEL ACCOR ETC AS PARTNERS but the truth us that there is no cooperation what so ever between them!! He did not even try to call reservations try and return our money, so it was tough beans either take the rooms or throw your money away to us!!! NEVER AGAIN ACCOR HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “December Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lazydays3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room on the night of December 12th 2008. This was our first trip to Paris and we wanted to be sure that we had booked a comfortable hotel. We were very pleased with our choice in the Mercure Arc de Triomphe. The staff were friendly, professional and courteous and the room was very nicely furnished,comfortable and spotlessly clean. Extra pillows were available in the room and although there were no tea/coffee making facilities this was available at no charge from reception. Check in and departure were flawlessly handled. The hotel is around a 10 minute walk from the Porte Maillot centre and around 1 minute from the Arc de Triomphe itself. You really couldn't get a more central location. We paid extra for the continental breakfast. This took the form of a buffet and included a choice of hot items (scrambled egg, pancakes and sausages) as well as an extensive cold choice. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: star1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently on a short break to paris. We arrived late off a Ryanair flight and walked to the property which we found after walking around in circles a lot first! I have to say that when I e-mailed the hotel to ask for directions from the Ryanair drop-off point, they werent too helpful. They just gave me the hotel's address again which didnt really clarify anything for me! Anyway, the hotel is only a 10 min walk from the Porte Maillot drop off point. My very first impresssion was Oh No we are right next to Stringfellows! I have to admit the strip club with like 5 bouncers on the door clouded my first impressions of the hotel especially when we got upstairs to discover no English TV channels but a host of hard porn entertainment (you need an access code to watch!). The next day when we actually got a chance to walk around teh area during the day, i realised that its actually a fab location and not seedy at all! We were a 5 minute walk from the arc de triomphe and the end of the Champs elysees. Its very handy to be right next to a Monoprix also for supplies! Theres a bar just down the road too called Indigo or Indiana or somthing like that...great to go to for Happy Hour between 5 and 8, half price beer and cocktails in a city where beer can be very pricey! Back to the hotel-the location is fab, the decor in the reception area is modern and nice and the hotel rooms are excellent. They are just like they look on the hotels website. The rooms are large by Paris standards, certainly larger than any other 3 star hotel ive stayed in the city. They are very modern, lovely large shower, big bed, mood lighting etc etc! There are tea and coffee making facilities too (no milk though!). The one reason Im giving the hotel a 4 and not a 5 is that we booked a weekend package through the hotels website that included a guide book, bottle of water , bed and breakfast and a late checkout until 4. When we arrived, there was no mention of teh package, we were just given keys to our room. I had to specifically ask teh next day. The reception staff werent friendly at all. They told me to take a water from the minibar and said I couldnt have the room until 4, only until 2. That was dissapointing as we had a late flight home and the late checkout was the primary reasonh we booked this hotel. If there is no availability, surely you should be told apologetically upon arrival, instead of having to ask when its part of your deal. Anyway...other than that, nice stay! If you can get the hotel at a good price, go 4 it but as always, i feel you spend so little time in your room that its not of so much importance on a short break. If I went back again, I would probably stay at Hotel Innova.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: Manekineko_AT
Reviews.Content: New hotel, 5 mins on foot from the Arc de Triomphe, situated in a nice area, between the CDG-Etoile RER/Metro and the Ternes Metro stations. Friendly staff. Did not try the breakfast buffet, as we found it overpriced. Room was small but clean. Modern furniture. A plexiglas wall separated bedroom and bath, but bath and shower had no door, so share with someone you know. WC does have a door. TV, Safe, minibar and tea&coffee making facilities in room. Comfy bed. Would choose this hotel again for a next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, located on a main street about 4 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe & M1 Metro line (Charles DeGaulle Etoille stop). Actual name of hotel is "Mercure Paris Arc De Triomphe Etoile", a 3-star on 27 avenue des Ternes. Rooms aren't like the hotel's photos above--they're new and nicer. Think "IKEA meets Paris"...hardwood floors, comfortable beds with duvets, flatscreen TV. Rooms were clean and spacious, and large enough for 2 people with luggage. As the previous guest wrote, there's no door/privacy for the shower and vanity. (Plus, if you prefer a shower, be sure to request it, otherwise you'll get a bathtub with a hand-mounted shower nozzle 2 feet off the ground.) Front desk staff were very friendly, except for one night clerk who was a grouch. The only thing I disliked is my room on the lower floor was noisy, even with soundproof windows. They were doing construction on the roof while I was there, and was awakened at 9am on Sunday a.m. by debris crashing into a dumpster. You can take the Air France bus from CDG airport to the Charles DeGaulle Etoille bus stop for 20 Euros RT, which is very convenient and takes less than an hour from airport. The Termes Metro stop is less than 2 blocks from the hotel, and you can make an easy connection to the main M1 line. On Saturdays and Sundays, there's a picturesque, local Parisian market just across Ave. des Termes near the FNAC electronics store, which sells bread, flowers, meat, seafood and wine. It's a great way to experience a true Parisian market, buy food for a picnic, or grab breakfast. If you don't mind taking the Metro, this is a great location. For those who don't want to walk or navigate the Metro, you would want to stay closer to Notre Dame or Louvre area, although I thought this was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pip1200
Reviews.Content: Ideal budget place to stay for a short break in Paris. Rooms are modern and very clean. Coffee/tea minibar(limited) in room. Beds new and comfy with duvets. Good aircon. Soundproofed windows but a bit noisy from floor above. Bathrooms no doors so only share with someone you know! Toilet does have a door. Selection of toiletries is above average. Very helpful and accommodating reception staff. Didn't stay for breakfast but the selection looked good. There is a PAUL patisserie across the road and a Monoprix express next door. Close to the Metro Ternes and Charles de Gaulle Etoile where the airport shuttle stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Europe, and have stayed at this hotel many times. It is in a great location, and it's always clean. Whenever I go back to Paris for vacation, I always check for availibility, but it is often full. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Tiny, Not stylish”
Reviews.Author: MikeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Champs Elysees, long walk to Louvre, etc. Great location but a bit disappointing. Feeling of a business hotel, no charm, tiny room. Nothing bad but nothing special.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Paris Arc de Triomphe Etoile
HotelInfo.Address: 27 avenue des Ternes, 75017 Paris, France
